diff_hunk:
@@ -530,7 +530,7 @@
 - func: dot_out(Tensor result, Tensor self, Tensor tensor) -> Tensor
   variants: function
 
-- func: einsum(std::string equation, TensorList tensors) -> Tensor
+- func: _einsum(std::string equation, TensorList tensors) -> Tensor
body:
I don't think the Python function should be called anything but einsum.
But we could keep the ATen name and use  torch._C.VariableFunctions.einsum from the Python wrapper and let the wrapper be torch.einsum in Python.
